author: Simon Rimmer
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Heat one tablespoon of the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat and fry the onion for 4-5 minutes, or until softened. Add the sherry and cook for a further 1-2 minutes, or until the volume of the liquid has reduced slightly.  Add the garlic, paprika, chilli, tomatoes and the remaining oil and cook for a further 18-20 minutes, or until the sauce is thick and the tomatoes have softened. Stir in the prawns and spoon into an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle over the breadcrumbs and bake for 15-17 minutes, or until golden-brown on top. Serve immediately with the crusty bread.
ingredients: 100ml/3½fl oz olive oil,  1 red onion, peeled, finely sliced ,  1 tbsp sherry,  2 garlic cloves, peeled, crushed ,  2 tsp smoked paprika,  1 tsp dried chili flakes,  8 plum tomatoes, chopped,  12 raw king prawns, shells and heads removed,  100g/3½oz breadcrumbs (preferably brioche),  1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  crusty bread, to serve
